reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award On June 15-19, 2015, APHIS in collaboration with the University of Delaware delivered a 5 day Emergency Response training course. This is a certificate course on Emergency Poultry Disease Response that was attended by twenty-one participants. Topics in the course were related to a comprehensive understanding of the influenza virus, surveillance, biosecurity, management of outbreak response and control, incident command structures, protecting the responder, depopulation, disposal, composting, and decontamination. The training program presented and used the “Delaware model,” which emphasizes close cooperation between government, industry and educational institutions to manage avian influenza outbreaks utilizing best management practices and technologies. In addition, participants earned continuing education units (CEU) necessary for veterinary or veterinary technician continuing education requirements. APHIS supported international attendees at the course..
